channel.title: Tech Talks
channel.description: Its a collection of technical talks that I enjoyed watching. I have avoided putting product announcements or company specific talks.You can also contribute to the list by forking on github.

item.title: RAMANUJAN: Letters from an Indian Clerk
item.description: Great documentary on indian mathematical genius Ramanujan.

item.title: Oral History of Bjarne Stroustrup
item.description: Great interview about history of C++ and System programming in general by C++ creator Bjarne Stroustrup.

item.title: LangNext 2014: State of System programming
item.description: Great panel of various system language designers about state of system programming.

item.title: Using Python to Code by Voice
item.description: Great talk on how to use state of the art voice recognize to code.

item.title: Binary Compatibility in Scala by Martin Odersky
item.description: Good talk on how Scala will implement binary compatibility in upcoming releases.

item.title: Simplicity In Scala Design
item.description: Great talk by ScalaTest developer, on how to use powerful features of Scala language in a useful way.

item.title: You can be a kernel hacker! by Julia evans
item.description: Great talk how to get started with linux kernel hacking.

item.title: Fixing Code at 100mph: Techniques to Improve How You Debug Servers
Lambdas in Java: A peek under the hood by Brian Goetz
item.description: Good talk on how lambdas are implemented in Java 8.

item.title: Clang MapReduce -- Automatic C++ Refactoring at Google Scale
item.description: Good talk on how to use map/reduce infrastructure and clang to improve quality of C++ code.
